meanings.definition: The act of reviving or restoring life or consciousness.
meanings.sent1: The revivification of the plant after watering it was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: Doctors worked hard to perform the revivification of the patient after the accident.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the revivification of a wilting flower, much to the audience's delight.
meanings.sent4: The revivification of the old building breathed new life into the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The revivification of the ancient tradition brought joy to the community.

meanings.definition: The process of bringing something back to life or vitality.
meanings.sent1: The revivification of the company's sales was a result of their new marketing strategy.
meanings.sent2: Nature's revivification of the forest after the wildfire was a testament to its resilience.
meanings.sent3: The revivification of the old car turned it into a shiny, working vehicle once again.
meanings.sent4: The revivification of the town's economy breathed new energy into the local businesses.
meanings.sent5: The revivification of the painting revealed its true beauty to the art enthusiasts.
